item.title: On the bend of the junction, 14th January
item.description:
There was absolutely no salt or grit on the roads. I was cycling VERY slowly but fell VERY hard because of black ice. I have now fractured my toe in two places and have multiple bruises as well as a bone bruise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince of Wales Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London

item.title: Litter which has been there for 3+ months, 14th January
item.description:
On the corner of willet way, Tudor way, and Petts wood road there has been construction rubbish left on the road and nearby areas. It is a white hard plastic type of rubbish which has been there since October 2025. There is additional rubbish there/road waste in the general area. I would’ve hoped in the past 3 months this would’ve been removed but it hasn’t and is remarkably still there polluting the area. To ensure the safety of our walkways, pets, and general wildlife, this should be actioned at the earliest convenience.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge blocks 50 % of pavement., 14th January
item.description:
Dear Madam, dear Sir, ​I am writing to request issuance of a formal notice on a persistent and dangerous obstruction caused by the two severely overgrown hedges of property 82 Emmanuel Road. ​The hedge in question has now been left to block *45%* of the pavement width. Because this property is situated on a curved road intersection, the obstruction is particularly hazardous. It forces pedestrians, including myself with a pushchair and neighbors in wheelchairs, to swerve into the live carriageway at a point where visibility for oncoming traffic is restricted. ​The owner of the property has been using a "salami technique" for the past 3 years. He has performed several cosmetic trims that remove a few leaves but fail to address the encroachment. The hedge has since doubled in width, leaving the pavement effectively impassable for double prams and mobility aids. ​As the hedge is significantly restricting the footway and creating a safety risk, I request that the Council issues a formal notice under Section 154 of the Highways Act 1980, requiring the owner to cut the vegetation back to the property boundary within the statutory timeframe. Please kindly revert back to me with an update.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Emmanuel Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
